Class GameMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameMap

  • public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int mapX 
      int mapY 
      int velX 
      int velY 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameMap()
      The constructor class loads the entire map and mapPart, sets the location name, and modifies JLabel text options for location.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkLocation()
      checkLocation compares the current mapX and mapY values to the HashMap entries to display the current location of the player in the JLabel location.
      void drawMap(java.awt.Graphics g)
      drawMap draws the map at the specified location and size.
      void loadMap()
      loadMap gets a 100x100 pixel subImage of the larger map image
      void moveMap(java.lang.String direction)
      moveMap is used in the GameScreen class keybinding actions to move the map in a specified direction.
      void putLocation(java.lang.String locationName, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      putLocation puts keys and values into the HashMap cities
      void setLocation()
      setLocation Sets the location of all cities and their coordinates
      void textOptions()
      textOptions sets the font, color, and bounds of the the JLabel location.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • mapX

        public int mapX

      • mapY

        public int mapY

      • velX

        public int velX

      • velY

        public int velY

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameMap

        public GameMap()
        The constructor class loads the entire map and mapPart, sets the location name, and modifies JLabel text options for location.

    • Method Detail

      • loadMap

        public void loadMap()
        loadMap gets a 100x100 pixel subImage of the larger map image

      • drawMap

        public void drawMap(java.awt.Graphics g)
        drawMap draws the map at the specified location and size.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object used to draw images.

      • moveMap

        public void moveMap(java.lang.String direction)
        moveMap is used in the GameScreen class keybinding actions to move the map in a specified direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - Specifies the direction in which to move the map

      • putLocation

        public void putLocation(java.lang.String locationName,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height)
        putLocation puts keys and values into the HashMap cities
        Parameters:
        locationName - Specifies the key in the HashMap entry.
        x - Specifies the x coordinate of the bounding rectangle.
        y - Specifies the y coordinate of the bounding rectangle.
        width - Specifies the width of the bounding rectangle.
        height - Specifies the height of the bounding rectangle.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation()
        setLocation Sets the location of all cities and their coordinates

      • checkLocation

        public void checkLocation()
        checkLocation compares the current mapX and mapY values to the HashMap entries to display the current location of the player in the JLabel location. If the current location isn't in the HashMap, it is set as "LofScape."

      • textOptions

        public void textOptions()
        textOptions sets the font, color, and bounds of the the JLabel location.
